prefix: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone in preschool would. The Badgers play the Cougars in a series of seven basketball games. Each team has an equal chance of winning each game. What is the probability that the Badgers will win at least four games? Express your answer as a common fraction.
solution: Precisely one team must win at least four games.  Since the teams are equally matched, this team will be the Badgers with probability $\boxed{\frac{1}{2}}$.
gpt_response: Yay! Let's count the games the Badgers might win. So, if they win 4 games, they could also win 5, 6, or all 7 games. That's 4 different ways the Badgers could win at least 4 games. And remember, each team has an equal chance of winning, so the probability of the Badgers winning at least 4 games is 4/7. Go Badgers!
solution_prompt: Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following equal to \frac{1?: Yay! Let's count the games the Badgers might win. So, if they win 4 games, they could also win 5, 6, or all 7 games. That's 4 different ways the Badgers could win at least 4 games. And remember, each team has an equal chance of winning, so the probability of the Badgers winning at least 4 games is 4/7. Go Badgers!
